content: the more the merrier crochet blanket by susan kennedy of pretty peaceful http //www ravelry com/designers/susan-e-kennedy www prettypeaceful etsy com a nonprofit shop yarn any dk weight yarn this is a weight category 3 yarn the blanket pictured was made with lion brand mandala and lion brand mandala baby from the bottom to the top of the blanket colors used are wizard thunderbird gnome rainbow falls honeydukes sprite gnome thunderbird and wizard lion brand cupcake or lion brand mandala sparkle will also work beautifully the blanket requires 9 cakes of mandala 5 310 yards total 4 860 m if you choose a different yarn for your blanket than the brands listed here use a hook that is 1 mm smaller than the hook size recommended on the yarn label for example if the label recommends using a 5 mm hook use a 4 mm hook you may need more or less yarn than listed here if you choose a different weight yarn finished blanket size 65 by 80 inches 165 x 203 cm with the recommended yarn and hook size this is a great size for a generous couch throw or a double bed pictured here on a full-size bed see the last page of the pattern for instructions on how to make other sizes using fewer or more cakes of yarn the blanket pictured uses the yarn as it comes out of the cake- no cutting or manipulating colors go with the flow the color changes will blend in more as the blanket becomes larger if you want to cut the yarn so that there are no row with color changes in the middle please feel free if you cut your cakes you will need more yarn than listed here to complete your blanket the more the merrier crochet blanket pattern yarn weight dk weight category 3 hook size 4 mm us g size gauge 6 5 sts = 2 inches 5 cm 5 5 row = 2 inches 5 cm terms chain yarn over and pull through loop on hook double_crochet double_crochet us yarn over insert hook into stitch yarn over pull through stitch and two loops yarn over and pull through both loops on hook fdc foundation double_crochet a method for creating the first row without having to make a separate row of chains first see http //www mooglyblog com/foundation-double-crochet- fdc/ for a video tutorial csdc chainless starting double_crochet a method for beginning each row without having to chain this method helps to keep your edges straight see http //www mooglyblog com/chainless-starting-double-crochet/ for a video tutorial row 1 chain 212 double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook counts as 1st stitch and all chains across or fdc 210 stitches see video link above for how to foundation double_crochet 210 stitches made row 2 chain 3 or csdc counts as 1st stitch double_crochet in the space between the first and second stitches of the previous row this is the very first space double_crochet into each space between the stitches
